file_content.text: When the Empire wins this war, I just hope they remember to release me.
The Republic may have a chance, with my help.
Those droids could destroy speeders mid-flight. They were tested against the Empire's strongest men.
Yes, the droids were made for the Empire. I supported the council's decision. I'm not ashamed.
The Republic's falling, and they expect brilliant men like me to go down with her. I won't do it.
The Republic's survived everything so far, including your droids.
The Republic's fine.
I'm aware. I've already noted several improvements to make.
Brilliant, huh?
Until you showed up, my droids were indestructible.
Are you through?
I don't expect you to understand. Things being what they are, I'm the one who has to adapt.
If the Republic is Corellia's future, I'm willing to look past my political views.
You've seen my designs in action. I could create similar things for the Republic--if they'll have me.
If you're willing, the Republic could use your skills.
Okay, help the Republic.
I'll let my staff know. Thank you for this chance--the Republic may be smarter than I thought.
A traitor like you can never be trusted again.
You're going to prison.
I expected as much. With us or against us, no matter what you can offer.
I'd better inform my team of our new criminal status. At least we'll face our punishment together.
Stay where you are, all of you. I won't let you cause any more damage.
With all due respect, Master Jedi, you're not authorized to be here.
Stop right there, Captain... Ensign... whatever you are! I don't want any trouble.
Are you insane? What kind of degenerate attacks a laboratory?
Those doors were pure durasteel, at least five layers thick. How did you even get inside?
Disaster relief droids don't care how thick your doors are.
Droids of my own.
Of course. I should have accounted for that.
I had to get inside to deal with your droids.
It doesn't matter.
Do you have to ask?
I suppose there's no way I could have prepared for a person of your... skill.
Ah. The Republic troops. A terrible business. I can assure you, my droids are not responsible.
They're equipped for combat, but only for defensive purposes. There's no need to destroy them.
Republic soldiers are dying. Your droids have to be stopped.
We have no choice.
You're assuming they can be stopped.
Nice try, pal.
I don't know what you're talking about.
Shut down the droids or watch them get destroyed.
I'm out of patience.
I won't argue with an armed intruder. Just give me a moment to make the proper adjustments.
These droids are my greatest work. I can't allow you to destroy them. I'm sorry.
I don't know how you got in, but you won't have my droids!
General Aves? The Empire's droids have been destroyed.
With Labor Valley under control, the Republic's set their sights on Axial Park. The Empire's launched a major offensive to keep us out.
Armies, walkers, trenches--they're already calling it the Battle of Axial Park. General Aves needs all the help he can get.
What's Axial Park?
Axial Park?
The greenest and most symbolic spot in Coronet City. You can find monuments and museums to every galactic conflict there.
I'm still sweating from my last favor to the general.
Can't I get a break?
We let up now, and the Empire could regroup. We're too close to give them that chance.
Axial Park is just a tram ride away from Capitol Square. We win this battle, and the Empire's cornered.
Head to Axial Park and check in with the general. He'll tell you what to do.
The general's a little busy right now, so you get me. CorSec will be there to deal with Danison Varik soon.
I wasn't expecting the councillor's information to check out. For your sake, I'm glad it did.
Councillor Belos has proven his loyalty.
He can be trusted.
He's proven he can keep things from the Empire. That doesn't make him loyal.
Have you considered the possibility that Councillor Belos is sincere?
Have some faith.
I might, if it was worth considering.
The councillor's our only inside man. We can't afford to hate him.
He's our ally now.
I can hate him all I want. You're the one doing the heavy lifting.
You sure know how to hold a grudge.
Still don't trust him?
Spend half your life protecting a traitor, then come talk to me about grudges.
Where does the Republic go from here?
What's next?
Councillor Belos will have other chances to turn on us.
This time, anyway.
If he's smart, he won't take them. If he isn't, he gets to deal with me.
Understood, Captain.
